pullRequest.body:
---
I have more (`AddConstEquiv`s, order, monotone maps) in a branch.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message

nodes.body: :v: urkud can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7619037480/job/20751376662)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7619037480/job/20751375343)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7619037480/job/20751376201)
could you scope this? I expect this won't be used so much outside of dynamics, so let's not block the notation for everyone.
should you add a `no_index` here, as per the library note "no_index around OfNat.ofNat"?
Is it really natural to restrict to the interval `Icc 0 a`? I.e., can you prove the same result using an arbitrary interval `Icc x (x + a)`, and then specialize to `x = 0` if you like?
I don't think you need the `no_index` here: it is only relevant for simp lemmas. Same thing below.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/AddConstMap): new file
